question_sentence: The prime minister of which country fled by helicopter as protesters surrounded their official residence?
evidence: The autocratic government of Sheikh Hasina, who has ruled the country since 2009, came to an abrupt end on Monday as she was whisked out of the capital, Dhaka, by helicopter following weeks of protests. She is now reportedly in Delhi and plans to seek political asylum abroad.

question_sentence: US shot putter Raven Saunders is gaining attention for wearing what item while competing at the Paris Olympics?
evidence: Saunders competed in the women's shot put qualification at the Paris Olympics, donning a full face mask and sunglasses. They dyed their hair green and purple to embody their "Hulk" alter ego, a persona Saunders uses to manage the intense pressure of a world-class competition.

question_sentence: Three planned Taylor Swift concerts in Vienna had to be called off due to what?
evidence: The three "Eras" tour shows in the Austrian capital were cancelled after police foiled a plan to stage a terrorist attack on the Ernst Happel Stadium. Two teenagers have been arrested and are being questioned over the plot.

question_sentence: US presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr revealed that he hid what in New York's Central Park?
evidence: In a video on social media, Kennedy told comedian Roseanne Barr that after a car in front of him hit a bear cub in the Hudson Valley, he put the dead cub under an old bicycle because he "thought it would be amusing for whoever found it or something".

question_sentence: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy confirmed Ukraine had deployed what military hardware for the first time?
evidence: Securing US approval for the delivery of the cutting-edge jets and training pilots to fly them has been a lengthy process, but Zelenskyy confirmed on Sunday that Ukraine's new F-16s have embarked on their first sorties in the battle to repel Russian invaders.

question_sentence: Which military base housing US and allied personnel was hit by a rocket attack in Iraq?
evidence: Two rockets landed inside the al-Asad air base, injuring at least five American troops and contractors, with one seriously wounded. It's unclear if the attack was a response to the assassinations of top Hamas and Hezbollah leaders, but the US is currently discussing drawing down its 2,500 troops stationed in Iraq.

question_sentence: Italian gymnast Alice D'Amato secured a surprise gold in which event at the Paris Olympics?
evidence: D'Amato pulled off a near flawless routine and – crucially – stayed upright in a final that saw four gymnasts, including Team USA's Simone Biles and Sunisa Lee, lose their footing.

question_sentence: Arizona's attorney general secured a guilty plea from how many Republicans, who falsely attested that Donald Trump won the state in 2020?
evidence: Arizona Attorney General Kris Mayes secured a guilty plea from one of 11 Republicans involved in a scheme to overturn President Joe Biden's electoral victory. However, the Arizona case "is not expected to go to trial until next year".

question_sentence: Who became Wales's new first minister following the resignation of Vaughan Gething?
evidence: Baroness Morgan, formerly the Welsh devolved government's health minister, will be the first woman to serve as first minister in the post's 25-year history after she was approved by the Senedd.

question_sentence: A US federal court ruled that which tech giant had engaged in anti-competitive business practices to maintain its dominance?
evidence: Judge Amit Mehta ruled on Monday that Google had violated antitrust laws, primarily by spending billions of dollars to ensure its search engine was the default option on smartphones and other devices, unfairly squeezing out would-be competitors.

question_sentence: Who did Vice President Kamala Harris name as her 2024 running mate?
evidence: Harris chose Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota as her running mate, elevating the former teacher and Army National Guard veteran to join the Democratic ticket.

question_sentence: A robust tropical storm is dumping catastrophic rainfall across the Southeast US this week. What is its name?
evidence: Millions were under storm alerts this week as Tropical Storm Debby unleashed widespread flooding in Florida, Georgia and South Carolina.

question_sentence: Which Olympic gymnast won the gold medal in the women's final floor exercise event?
evidence: Brazil’s Rebeca Andrade defeated US women’s gymnastics stars Simone Biles and Jordan Chiles in the final floor exercise competition at the Paris Olympics. In a viral moment that lit up social media, the US gymnasts bowed to the Brazilian, who raised her arms in triumph.

question_sentence: How many NASA astronauts on the International Space Station are waiting to come home due to several issues plaguing Boeing's Starliner spacecraft?
evidence: Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams — two veteran NASA astronauts piloting the first crewed test flight of Boeing's Starliner spacecraft — have been in space for more than 60 days, roughly seven weeks longer than initially expected.

question_sentence: Which type of common product was banned by the EPA this week?
evidence: The EPA issued an emergency suspension of the common weedkiller DCPA, also known as Dacthal, citing risks to unborn babies. It marks the first time the agency has used its emergency suspension authority in 40 years.

question_sentence: Which music superstar canceled three concerts this week after authorities discovered an alleged terror plot to attack the venue?
evidence: Three Taylor Swift concerts in Austria were canceled after authorities said they foiled a terror attack planned for the Vienna leg of her blockbuster Eras tour.

question_sentence: Which company lost a massive antitrust lawsuit this week?
evidence: Google lost a massive antitrust lawsuit Monday over its search dominance. The ruling is a stunning rebuke of the company's most important business and has the potential to reshape how millions of Americans get their information online.

question_sentence: Which state passed a law requiring all public school classrooms to display a poster of the Ten Commandments?
evidence: Louisiana passed a state law requiring public schools to display posters with the Ten Commandments. This week, officials in the state considered possible poster designs that may soon be in K-12 schools.

question_sentence: Which streaming service announced a new round of price hikes this week?
evidence: Disney announced price hikes across the board for Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+. Subscribers will see an increase in their bills beginning in October, the company said.

question_sentence: Which massive animal sculpture will be unveiled in New York City this fall?
evidence: A 16-foot tall pigeon will loom over Manhattan's High Line later this year. The pigeon population in New York City is estimated to be larger than its human population, with around nine million birds compared to the nearly eight million people living in the city.

question_sentence: What was the primary reason for the closure of Tierra Mexi-Cali Grill in Pike Creek?
choices: The restaurant lost its liquor license.
The restaurant closed due to a lack of customers.
The specific reason for the closure was not provided.
evidence: Optional text appears on the score summary screen underneath the correct answer

question_sentence: What percentage of Delaware teachers surveyed by the Delaware State Education Association (DSEA) reported that they are more likely to retire or leave education earlier than planned?
What organization responded to the beached pilot whale at Delaware Seashore State Park on Monday?
choices: Marine Education, Research and Rehabilitation Institute

question_sentence: What unusual situation did boaters George and Tammy Hart and their daughter Emily encounter while boating near the Lewes-Rehoboth Canal?
choices: They saw a dolphin swimming near their boat.
They discovered a rare bird species.
They encountered a floating log blocking their path.

question_sentence: What is the main event that concludes the first-ever Inland Bays Oyster Week at the Delaware beaches?
What was the median sold price of homes in Delaware in June 2024?
What is the primary goal of the EPA’s Environmental Justice Thriving Communities Grantmaking program?
choices: To provide funding for large corporations to develop new technologies.
To promote international environmental policies and agreements.
To fund research on climate change in urban areas.

question_sentence: What is the primary claim made by the Change Can’t Wait PAC regarding its support for candidates?
choices: The PAC explicitly supports Matt Meyer for governor.
The PAC does not support any candidate but runs ads mentioning candidates.
The PAC supports Lt. Gov. Bethany Hall-Long for governor.

question_sentence: What can patrons with a Delaware library card borrow for free from the library?
choices: Garden tools, blood pressure cuffs, and pickleball kits

question_sentence: What notable achievement did Valarie Allman accomplish at the Paris Olympics?
choices: She set a new world record in discus throw.
She won her second consecutive Olympic gold medal in discus throw.
She broke the national record for discus throw.
